shortcontents.shortcontent: I) I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols.1ra-119v) I-1) Introduction (fols. 1ra-2vb, 67ra-68rb l.6), incomplete [the middle part of the text is in MGM-008a] - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book (fol. 1ra-vb) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 2ra-vb, 67ra-68rb l.6) I-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 47 miracles (fols. 3ra-119vb).

donors.donor: Täklä Haymanot is mentioned in the concluding supplication formulas on fol. 117va and on fol. 119rb, and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. Nǝblä Dǝngǝl is mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 10vb, 13rb. Wälättä Mikaʾel is mentioned in the supplication formulas in the part of the Ms. written by hand b.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 18th cent. - first half of the 19th cent.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is destroyed. The sewing is damaged. It has been very crudely repaired with stitches. The back board is missing. The front board is cracked and of irregular shape. Many fols. are stained with water, wax and dirt; on some fols. the ink has faded away. Fol. 3 is damaged by rodents with the loss of text. Some fols. are misplaced. There are 6 fols. missing in quire I. They have been registered under MGM-008a (fols. 120-125). The correct arrangement of the fols. of quire I is as follows: 1, 124, 122, 120, 121, 123, 125, 2. The appropriate sequence of the remaining fols. is: 67r-92v, 31r-33v, 35r-36v, 34, 37v, 3r-24v, 57r-66v, 38r-56v, 114r-117v, 25r-30v, 112r-113v, 93r-111v, 118r-119v. Miracles 1-40 are written on fols. 1-24v, 31r-92v, 114r-117v in hand a. Miracles 41-50 written on fols. 25r-30v, 93r-111v, 112r-113v, 118r-119v in hand b. Holes are amended on fols. 33, 82, 90, 115.

bindings.binding: Two leather boards (the back board is missing). One pair of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

txfolios.txfolio: 119+1; foliation mistake: two leaves were foliated with the same number 51; their pictures were given numbers 51 and 51a.

squires.squire:
I፬(2[+6 fols. are missing]; s.l.: 1, no stub, 2, no stub/fols. 1r-2v) – II(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 3r-9v) – III፯(8/fols. 10r-16v) – ፰IV፰(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 17r-24v) – V(6/fols. 25r-30v) – VI(7; s.l.: 3, stub before 4/fols. 31r-37v) – VII(10/fols. 38r-47v) – VIII(10/fols. 48r-56v) – IX፱(?)(10/fols. 57r-66v) –X(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 67r-75v) – XI(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 76r-84v) – XII(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XIII(4/fols. 93r-96v) – XIV(8/fols. 97r-104v) – XV(7; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 105r-111v) – XVI(2/fols. 112r-113v) – XVII(4/fols. 114r-117v) – XVIII(2/fols. 118r-119v).
Many fols. are misplaced; for their correct arrangement s. State of preservation. Fols. 25r-30v, 93r-111v, 112r-113v, 118r-119v have been added later. The six-missing fols. of quire I are registered under MQM-008a. The fols. of quire VI are mispalced. Its current state is as follows: it consists of a bifolio (fols. 31 and 37, leaves 1 and 7, respectively) into which two other bifolios have been inserted. The first one embraces fols. 32 and 34, (leaves 2 and 4) while the second embraces fols. 35 and 36 (leaves 5 and 6). A single leaf with a stub has been inserted between fols. 32 and 34.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 18th cent. - first half of the 19th cent.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine; hand b: mediocre

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the supplicants; numbers and incipits of miracles; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and/or their elements.
A few groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-2.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The miracles are introduced with the words mǝʿǝraf “chapter”, täʾamǝr “miracle”, täʾamrihu “his miracle”, nägär “speech”. - Sections of Text I-1 have been treated as miracles and given numbers 1-3. Thus, the 1st miracle proper bears number 4 (fol. 68rb). The numeration is correct.

extras.extra: - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally and in the margins, in the main hands: e.g., fols. 2rb, 4ra, 9ra, 13vb, 32vb, 38vb, 55rb, 70va, 72ra, 74ra, 77vab, 82vb, 85rb, 88va, 104ra, 109rb, 113vb. - Omitted letters and words written interlineally, in a secondary hand: fols. 51avab, 51rab, 60vb, 65rb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 4va, 90va, 97rb, 99vb, 101va. - Erasures: 23vab, 34va, 78va, 79rb, 79vb, 104va, 117ra. - Scribbles, doodles: 1r, 9v, 11r, 17r, 18r, 25r, 77r, 117vb, 119v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Simply decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of the first fol. of the quire and in the right upper corner of the last fol. of the quire: fols. 2v, 16v, 17r, 24v, 66v. Some quire marks have faded away or have been erased.
